resources.string: ToastGenerator
A full belly, a heavy purse, and a light heart.
May we be happy and our enemies know it.
May your joys be as deep as the ocean, and your misfortunes as light as its foam.
May we look forward with happiness, and backward without regret.
The best of happiness, honor, and fortunes keep with you.
May every day be happier than the last.
Here\'s to doing and drinking, not sitting and thinking.
May we always have the class To rise and get up off our ass
Don\'t let the bastards grind you down.
May the happiest days of your past be the saddest days of your future.
Here\'s to you, my honest friend, Wishing these hard times to mend.
A speedy calm to till the storms of life.
Here\'s to the pressure we face - for it is, after all, pressure that turns coal into diamonds.
May the sunshine of hope dispel calamity\'s clouds.
As Shakespeare said in The Mary Wives of Windsor, let us "Drink down all unkindness."
May you live to learn well, and learn to live well.
May the Lord love us but not call us too soon.
May your fire never go out.
May the clouds in your life be only a background for a lovely sunset.
May you live to be a hundred-and decide the rest for yourself.
May you live as long as you want to and may you want to as long as you live.
As Baba Meher said, "Don't worry, be happy."
Eat thy bread with joy, and drink thy wine with a merry heart. -Ecclesiastes 9:7
Here\'s to you from morning till night; Here\'s to the person with courage to fight­ The courage to fight and the courage to live­ The courage to learn, and to love, and forgive.
Here\'s to short shoes and long corns for our enemies.
May we always remember the words of Epictetus, who said, "Only the educated are free."
My country, great and free! Heart of the world, I drink to thee!
May we always part with regret and meet again with pleasure
May your luck be like the capital of Ireland--- Always Dublin
Here\'s to blue skies and green lights.
Let\'s drink to love, which is nothing-unless it\'s divided by two
